dict.string: Expert Systems Domain Specific well defined domain many experts that can answer questions about domain expert can give much better answers than trained novice Consultations asks questions of users to arrive at answers Confidence Factors Certainty of conclusions People Involved Knowledge Engineer the person who develops expert systems Skills technical must understand expert system approach to problem solving be familiar with expert system programming languages social interact with domain experts and users knowledge acquistion good interviewing skills get domain expert to open up - think out loud NLP - Neuro Linguistic Programming psychology subfield observational skils set people at ease get people to open up to you have to get experts onboard with the project - could threaten experts job security appeal to their ego - "I will immortalize your expertise" expert systems are limited, won't replace expert - expert system handles more mundane tasks expert systems handle situations expert doesn't want to deal with Process Project Scoping narrow focus Recruit Experts verify they really are top experts in field somebody that you can easily interact with Familiarize Self with Domain Knowledge Acquisition BOTTLENECK! it is hard to get good information out of experts Develop Prototype let domain expert play with prototype, get feedback Fine Tuning Ongoing Maintenance Learning Systems get better the more they are used Domain Experts experts in the field Users people who use the expert system
